title: How I Would Manage a $100,000 Inheritance
subtitle: A thoughtful approach to using an inheritance for long-term stability and legacy honoring.
content:
How I Would Manage a $100,000 Inheritance

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. If any of this is helpful, check out my new podcast, Your Money Guide on the Side, by clicking the link in my bio.

1. Don’t Treat It Like a Bonus

Don’t treat the inheritance like a bonus or house money. Windfalls are emotional money. If you spend it fast, you might be trying to outrun the weight of where it came from.

2. Park It for 90 Days

Park it now for 90 days before making any decisions. Whether in a high-yield savings account or short-term money markets, give yourself time to think, not to react.

3. Align the Funds

Use the money to stabilize your future—whether that's investing, paying down debt, or creating that emergency fund. In part, this action honors your past and might even be something your loved one would have smiled at.

Conclusion

Remember, it’s not just money; it’s a legacy. Slow down and be intentional, as it’s the best way to respect both.
